alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 2:49PM PST until February 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Elevations above 500 feet may see additional snow up to 5 inches. Winds gusting 20 to 25 mph but as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 1 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With winds increasing through the evening, may see periods of reduced visibility due to blowing and falling snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
